temples.name: Pashupatinath Temple
temples.significance: Most sacred Hindu temple in Nepal, UNESCO World Heritage Site. Main center for Shivaratri celebrations.
temples.description: The holiest Shiva temple in Nepal, located on the banks of the Bagmati River. Sadhus gather here from across South Asia for Maha Shivaratri.

temples.name: Swayambhunath Stupa
temples.significance: Ancient Buddhist stupa with iconic Buddha eyes. Known as Monkey Temple.
temples.description: One of the oldest Buddhist monuments in Nepal, overlooking Kathmandu Valley. Pilgrimage site for Buddha Jayanti.

temples.name: Boudhanath Stupa
temples.significance: Largest stupa in Nepal and center of Tibetan Buddhism. UNESCO World Heritage Site.
temples.description: The largest spherical stupa in Nepal, surrounded by Tibetan monasteries. Major celebration site for Losar.

temples.name: Kathmandu Durbar Square
temples.significance: Ancient royal palace complex. Main venue for Indra Jatra and Kumari chariot procession.
temples.description: Historic royal palace square with temples, shrines and the Kumari house. Center of Indra Jatra celebrations.

temples.name: Patan Durbar Square
temples.significance: Ancient Newar city center. Home of Rato Machhindranath Jatra and Krishna Janmashtami.
temples.description: Medieval palace complex with Krishna Mandir. Starting point for the Rato Machhindranath chariot festival.

temples.name: Bhaktapur Durbar Square
temples.significance: Best preserved medieval city. Main venue for Bisket Jatra chariot festival.
temples.description: Ancient Newar city with 55 Window Palace. Famous for dramatic Bisket Jatra with giant lingam pole.

temples.name: Tundikhel
temples.significance: Historic parade ground in central Kathmandu. Venue for Ghode Jatra horse festival.
temples.description: Large open parade ground where the Nepal Army performs horse acrobatics during Ghode Jatra.

temples.name: Kumari Ghar
temples.significance: Residence of the Living Goddess (Royal Kumari of Kathmandu).
temples.description: Three-story structure in Kathmandu Durbar Square where the living goddess Kumari resides. She appears on the balcony during festivals.

temples.name: Janaki Mandir
temples.significance: Birthplace of goddess Sita in Janakpur. Major pilgrimage for Ram Navami.
temples.description: Magnificent Mughal-Rajput architecture temple dedicated to Goddess Sita in Janakpur.

temples.name: Krishna Mandir
temples.significance: Stone temple in Patan Durbar Square. Center of Krishna Janmashtami celebrations.
temples.description: 17th century stone temple with 21 spires. Thousands queue overnight on Krishna Janmashtami.

temples.name: Budhanilkantha Temple
temples.significance: Giant reclining Vishnu statue in a water tank. Major Vishnu pilgrimage site.
temples.description: 5th century reclining Vishnu (Jalasayana Narayan) in a pond at the base of Shivapuri hill.

temples.name: Changu Narayan Temple
temples.significance: Oldest Hindu temple in Nepal (4th century). UNESCO World Heritage Site.
temples.description: Ancient two-tiered pagoda with intricate stone and wood carvings. Hilltop location with valley views.

temples.name: Rato Machhindranath Temple (Bungamati)
temples.significance: Winter home of the red Machhindranath deity. Bhoto Jatra culmination point.
temples.description: Shikhara-style temple in Bungamati village. The deity spends 6 months here, 6 months in Patan.

temples.name: Dakshinkali Temple
temples.significance: Most important Kali temple in Nepal. Major animal sacrifice site during Dashain.
temples.description: Open-air temple at the confluence of two streams. Devotees offer animal sacrifices on Tuesdays and Saturdays.

temples.name: Taleju Bhawani Temple
temples.significance: Royal goddess temple. Opens only on Dashain Navami for one day annually.
temples.description: Triple-roofed pagoda in Kathmandu Durbar Square. The tallest temple in the square, open to Hindus only on Maha Navami.
